725433f-a.text:
52nd Street (Astoria Road), east side, in 39th Drive. This building will either be moved or demolished because it is in the line of 39th Drive. This mansion and estate, which belonged to J.A. Merke in 1860 and to C.Windmuller from 1873 to 1891, was still in the family in 1909: and still standing in 1927. In 1909, the estate was bounded on the north by Middleburg Ave., on the east by Woodside Ave., on the west by Astoria Road, and on the south by Jane Sussdorf's Estate and Public School No. 11. This is a set of three views. No. 1 shows the gate entrance at 47 Woodside Ave., while
Views No. 2 and 3 show the mansion.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

725308f-b.text:
39th Drive, south side, just east of 52nd Street, showing the Windmuller House. The property comprised eight acres in 1891 and was bounded by what is now 39th and 40th Avenues and
52nd and 54th Streets.
P. L. Sperr  November 5, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2,3

725309f-b.text:
39th Drive, south side, just east of 52nd Street, showing the Windmuller House and part of the estate. Views 2 and 3 show the roadway to the house and a hitching post.
P. L. Sperr  November 5, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2,3

725432f-c.text:
52nd Street, east side, in line of 39th Drive, showing in three views the J.A. Merke house of 1880. See other views for more data.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
